intro: Cryptantha barbigera var. inops, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
